name: 黃如瑩
objective: The purpose of this course is, first, to clarify key concepts in the understanding and interpretation of literary/cultural texts, and secondly, to demonstrate the ways in which important steps and maneuvors should be undertaken in order to compose a piece of promising academic writing.
schedule:
Instructor: Dr. Ju-ying Vinia Huang (黃如瑩 老師)
Office hours: Tuesdays 2:10-4:00; every other Friday 4:10-5:00 (Weeks 3, 5, 7…)
Contact: vinia@ntut.edu.tw

I.　　Syllabus
1.　　Week One 2016/2/22 
Introduction to keywords: plot development, rising action, conflict, (anti)climax, a turning point, etc.
2. Week Two 2016/2/29: No class due to 2/28 National Memorial Day

The 1st task: Three-act structure 
3.　　Week Three 2016/3/7: Setup, conflict, and resolution
4.　　Week Four 2016/3/14: Departure, adventure, and return

The 2nd task: Forms of narrative
5. Week Five 2016/3/21: linear, nonlinear, and interactive
6. Week Six 2016/3/28: foreshadow, flashback, and warped time/space 
 
The 3rd task: Modes of narration
7. Week Seven 2016/4/4: the first, second, and third person point of view
8. Week Eight 2016/4/11: omnipresent and limited point of view 

The 4th task: Writing on great themes of life
9. Week Nine 2016/4/18 (Midterm exam week): love, war, and death

The 5th task: Analyzing the narrator and main character
10. Week Ten 2016/4/25: reliable and unreliable narrators
11. Week Eleven 2016/5/2: No class due to 5/1 National Labor’s Day
12. Week Twelve 2016/5/9: tragic flaw, inner conflict, psyche, double

The 6th task: Interpreting Culture and ideology
13. Week Thirteen 2016/5/16: Dominant, recondite, and residual culture; cultural text and cultural practice; cultural hegemony; colonization
14. Week Fourteen 2016/5/23: class, race, gender, ethnicity, colonization, and ecological awareness

The 7th task: Writing on different genres of literature
15. Week Fifteen 2016/5/30: novel and prose
16. Week Sixteen 2016/6/6: poetry and drama

The 8th task: Writing on arts and multi-media texts
17. Week Seventeen 2016/6/13: painting and sculpture
18. Week Eighteen 2016/6/20: TV drama and film 

II.　　Percentile distribution of final grades
1.　　Writing assignments: 4% X 15 = 60%
2.　　Participation in classroom discussion and attendance: 40%
